Rosenblatt Weaver stress s for student

Editors note This is the first of a threepart series outlining the platforms of the candidates for  Undergraduate Student Government president and vice president PERIOD

David Rosenblatt and Mary Weaver said they will work to improve the quality of life for University students if elected Undergraduate Student Government president and vice president PERIOD

 said Rosenblatt sophomoreaccounting PERIOD

Weaver juniorliberal arts added that USG like any organization gains strength from its foundation PERIOD To make the entire organization strong the pair wants to involve as many students as possible PERIOD

 Weaver said PERIOD

The candidates said they plan to publicize openings in USG through the colleges because many USG departmental positions offer experience for students in majors such as journalism and political science PERIOD

 Rosenblatt said PERIOD

In addition they want all students to feel connected with USG Weaver said PERIOD They plan to distribute a newsletter so the student body is abreast of USG projects PERIOD

Rosenblatt said from day one they will be able to get their message across and implement their plans because they are already familiar with the USG network PERIOD

Rosenblatt is a South Halls senator assistant director of the USG political affairs department and former chairman of the USGsponsored studyathon PERIOD Weaver is a town senator appropriations committee chairwoman and board member of the USG movie coop PERIOD Both served on the University Student Executive Councils governmental advisory committee PERIOD

 Rosenblatt added PERIOD

If elected they plan to expand the state lobbying efforts for increased appropriations to the University begun by USEC he added PERIOD

 Rosenblatt said PERIOD

Rosenblatt and Weaver said they would like to increase the Universitys voice in Harrisburg by encouraging more students parents and alumni to fight for state appropriations PERIOD

If tuition is lowered the quality of life at the University would improve because students would have more money to relax with Rosenblatt said PERIOD

Rosenblatt and Weaver said they will also work to increase cooperation between USG and State College PERIOD

In recent years decisions have been made without taking students into consideration Rosenblatt said PERIOD The open container law and noise ordinance affect students lifestyles and therefore the quality of their lives PERIOD

They said they plan to set up liaisons between USG and town organizations and will try to establish student internships in the borough council office Rosenblatt said PERIOD

In addition they will work within USGs minority affairs department on the minority recruitment and retention issues Weaver said PERIOD
